TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit IMsalMtlsHttpClientFactory implements class Microsoft.Identity.Client.IMsalHttpClientFactory

Docs.summary: A factory responsible for creating HttpClient instances configured for mutual TLS (mTLS). This factory is intended for use to secure communication with Azure AD using mTLS. For more details on HttpClient instancing, see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.net.http.httpclient?view=net-8.0#instancing.
Docs.remarks: Implementations of this interface must be thread-safe. It is important to reuse HttpClient instances to avoid socket exhaustion. Do not create a new HttpClient for each call to . If your application requires Integrated Windows Authentication, set to true. This interface is designed to support mTLS scenarios.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Net.Http.HttpClient GetHttpClient(class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 x509Certificate2) cil managed
Public Function GetHttpClient (x509Certificate2 As X509Certificate2) As HttpClient

Docs.param: The certificate to be used for MTLS authentication.
Docs.summary: Returns an HttpClient configured with a certificate for mutual TLS authentication. This method enables advanced MTLS scenarios within Azure AD communications in MSAL.
Docs.returns: An HttpClient instance configured with the specified certificate.
